node.title: Parents of Aishwarya Aswath handed independent report into death six months after demanding answers
node.alt: A head and shoulders of a young girl smiling, wearing sunglasses and holding two thumbs up
node.description: The parents of Aishwarya Aswath, who died after waiting two hours for treatment at Perth Children's Hospital, are handed a copy of the independent review into the seven-year-old's death.
node.content:
["The family of Aishwarya Aswath has been given a copy of the independent report\u00a0into her care at Perth Children's Hospital,\u00a0more than six months after they called for an external review into the seven-year-old's death.\u00a0", "A damning internal review,\u00a0released in May, found there were failures to address the concerns of Aishwarya's parents on their daughter's deteriorating condition in the lead up to her death on April 3.", "The report\u00a0found\u00a0there was an overall \"uncoordinated plan of care\" for Aishwarya, who waited two hours for treatment\u00a0before she died of a bacterial infection.\u00a0", "\"The panel found there were a cascade of missed opportunities to address parental concerns and incomplete assessments, with a delay in escalation, which may have contributed to the patient's outcome,\" it\u00a0found.", "Eleven recommendations were made, including improvement to the triage process, a clear pathway for parents to escalate concerns to staff, a review of cultural awareness and the development of an established sepsis recognition diagnostic tool in the PCH emergency department.\u00a0", "", "
Aishwarya's parents Aswath Chavittupara and Prasitha Sasidharan called for an independent inquiry into their daughter's death.\u00a0(ABC News: West\u00a0Matteeussen)
", "Aishwarya's parents Aswath Chavittupara and Prasitha Sasidharan were unsatisfied with the internal review and\u00a0began a hunger strike in early May to call for the\u00a0independent inquiry to ensure no other parents suffered the same ordeal they went through.\u00a0", "On May 25, WA Health Minister Roger Cook announced an independent investigation, which he said would take about 10 weeks to complete.", "The Aswath family was understood to have received a copy of the report on Monday \u2014 25 weeks after Mr Cook made the announcement.", "
Inquiry aimed at learning from 'tragic' case, says Health Minister
", "The inquiry was undertaken by the Australian Commission on Safety and Quality in Health Care.", "\"The inquiry will focus on the specific factors that contributed to Aishwarya's death in the PCH ED on\u00a0April 3, 2021 and, more generally, the approach to clinical governance, risk and adverse incidents at PCH,\" Mr Cook told state parliament in May.", "\"The inquiry team, as appointed by the ACSQHC, will include medical and nursing leads with tertiary hospital experience of paediatric emergency medicine and members with experience in clinical governance, safety investigations with regard to human factors and medical administration.\"", "", "
Health Minister Roger Cook says the report was needed to restore public confidence in WA's flagship children's hospital.
", "He initially said the report, which\u00a0details the findings, conclusions and recommendations of the inquiry, would be completed within approximately 10 weeks from the commencement of the inquiry.", "\"Our ultimate goal must be to learn from this tragic case, to not only honour the memory of Aishwarya\u00a0but also restore public confidence in our flagship children's hospital.\"", "The state government was expected to table the report in state parliament later today.\u00a0"]
